solution_line_template: The difference in width between where they're starting from and their destination is {destination_width}-{starting_width} = <<{destination_width}-{starting_width}={width_difference}>>{width_difference} yards

The width increases {width_increase_per_distance} yards every {distance_for_increase} m along the river so they would have to cover ({width_difference}/{width_increase_per_distance})*{distance_for_increase} = <<({width_difference}/{width_increase_per_distance})*{distance_for_increase}={distance_to_cover}>>{distance_to_cover} meters
Traveling at the rate of {travel_rate}m/s, he will spend {distance_to_cover}/{travel_rate} = <<{distance_to_cover}/{travel_rate}={time_taken}>>{time_taken} seconds
